sentences.sContent: They are often available at a discount.
sentences.sCn: 它们经常可以以折扣价买到。

sentences.sContent: This has forced airlines to discount fares heavily in order to spur demand.
sentences.sCn: 这已经迫使多家航空公司对机票大幅打折以刺激需求。

sentences.sContent: ...you might be able to get a discount if you fly economy class...
...Apple's fortunes suffered from an innovation discount during Jobs' absence...

phrases.pCn: 打折扣；不受欢迎，没销路
现金收支折现法；贴现现金流

remMethod.val: dis(分离) ＋ count(计算) → 不计算在内的部分 → 折扣

trans.tranOther: a reduction in the usual price of something

trans.tranCn: 将…打折扣； 不信； 漠视， 低估
trans.tranOther: If a shop or company discounts an amount or percentage from something that they are selling, they take the amount or percentage off the usual price
